intro: Silene edgeworthii, commonly known as the Edgeworth's campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive pink or red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight. Silene edgeworthii has simple, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
